content: A computer is a machine that helps you perform many tasks, such as writing, browsing the internet, and watching videos.
It can also be used to listen to music, make video calls, and play games.
Computers are used in homes, offices, schools, and many other places.
They help make work easier and faster.
Desktop: are computers that are placed on a desk and used in one place
Laptop: are computers that are small and portable; easy to carry
Tablet/Smartphone: are ‘Touchscreen’ computers that are very portable
All of these devices are types of computers.

slides.slide_title: Two Main Parts of a Computer
content: Hardware: the physical parts you can touch, like the keyboard and monitor
Software: the programs and apps that run inside the computer
Both hardware and software work together to make the computer useful.
Software includes programs like browsers (Google Chrome), word processors (Microsoft Word), and games.
Without software, the computer cannot do anything.
Software gives instructions that tell the hardware what to do.
Computers help us work, learn, and play
Types include desktop, laptop, and tablet/smartphone
Hardware and software are both needed for a computer to function

Subtitles are available in Tagalog and English.
The monitor is the screen that shows you what the computer is doing.
It displays text, images, and videos.
It is similar to a television screen but is used with a computer.
The keyboard is used to type letters, numbers, and symbols.
Each key sends a command or input to the computer.
Common keys include letters (A-Z), numbers (0-9), and special keys like Enter and Spacebar.
The mouse moves the pointer on the screen.
You can click to select items, double-click to open them, or drag to move things.
Some computers use a touchpad instead of a mouse.
The CPU is called the “brain” of the computer.
It processes all the instructions from the software and controls what happens.
On desktops, the CPU is usually in a large box or tower. On laptops, it is built inside.
Printer – to print papers or photos
Speakers – to play sound or music
Webcam – for video calls
These are called “peripherals” and help add more functions.
Watch this short video that explains this lesson in Tagalog.
Subtitles are available in Tagalog and English.
To turn on a computer, press the power button on the CPU or laptop.
Wait for a few seconds while the computer loads.
When it is ready, you will see the desktop screen.
To turn off the computer, click the Start Menu, then choose Shut Down.
Do not unplug the computer or press the power button to turn it off.
Shutting down properly keeps the computer safe and working well.
If the computer is slow or not responding, you can click Restart.
Restarting closes all programs and turns the computer off and on again.
This often fixes small computer problems
The CPU is called the “brain” of the computer.
It processes all the instructions from the software and controls what happens.
On desktops, the CPU is usually in a large box or tower. On laptops, it is built inside.
✅ Always shut down or restart using the Start Menu
✅ Avoid turning off power suddenly
✅ Restart if your computer is frozen or slow

The desktop is the main screen you see after turning on your computer.
It shows icons, the taskbar, and the background image.
You can start many actions from the desktop.
Icons are small pictures that represent programs or files
Double-click an icon to open it.
Icons help you quickly access what you need.
The taskbar is the bar at the bottom of the screen.
It shows open programs and quick tools like volume and internet in the system tray.
You can click on taskbar icons to switch between programs.
Click the Start Button on the bottom-left corner to see your programs and settings.
You can also shut down or restart the computer from the Start Menu.
The Start Menu is your main control panel.
✅ The desktop is your main screen
✅ Icons help open programs and files
✅ The taskbar shows what’s running
✅ The Start Button opens programs and settings(helps you access everything)

A mouse is a small device that helps you move the pointer on the screen.
It usually has two buttons: left and right, and sometimes a scroll wheel.
The pointer follows your hand movements using the mouse.
Single-click: Press the left button once to select an item
Double-click: Press the left button twice quickly to open a file or program
Right-click: Press the right button to open a menu of options
Click and hold the left button over the item
Move the mouse to drag it
Release the button to place it in a new location

Subtitles are available in Tagalog and English.
You can open a program by:
- Double-clicking its icon on the desktop
- Clicking the Start menu and selecting the program from the list
To close a program, click the 'X' at the top-right corner of its window.
Closing programs you’re not using helps your computer run smoothly.
- Minimize: Hides the window but keeps it open (click the “-” button)
- Maximize: Makes the window full screen (click the square button)
- Restore Down: Shrinks it back to original size

You may need to use two or more programs at the same time.
Instead of closing them, you can switch between them easily.
Click on a program’s icon in the taskbar to bring it to the front.
The taskbar is the row of icons at the bottom of the screen.
Pressing Alt key + Tab key on the keyboard to quickly switch between open programs.
Hold the Alt key, tap Tab, and release when you see the one you want.
A pretty help[ful shortcut for multitasking!

The Start Menu is where you find programs, settings, and power options.
Click the Start button at the bottom-left corner of the screen to open it.
In the Start Menu, you can:
- Scroll through the list of apps
- Type the name of a program in the search bar to find it quickly
From the Start Menu, you can also:
- Shut Down the computer
- Restart it
- Put it to Sleep (low-power mode)
